entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 9:42PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM TO BRING STRONG GUSTY WINDS AND HEAVY RAIN SATURDAY INTO SUNDAY... A strong storm system will bring strong and gusty winds to the Bristol Bay region late Saturday through Sunday. The strongest winds are expected late Saturday night through Sunday morning. Here are some specific impacts:

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 9:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...UNSEASONABLY STRONG STORM WILL IMPACT KODIAK ISLAND, THE KENAI PENINSULA, AND ANCHORAGE THIS WEEKEND... A strong storm system, more reminiscent of weather experienced in the Spring or Fall seasons, will track toward southern Alaska this weekend bringing widespread heavy rain and strong winds. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:19PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels Through the Weekend... Runoff from rainfall and remaining snowmelt will cause rivers draining the Brooks Range to rise to bankfull and possibly overbank in some low lying areas into the weekend. The high water will cover gravel bars and push water up to the brush line. Those living or recreating along rivers draining the Brooks Range are

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 09 at 8:22AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water Levels On Rivers and Streams... Recent warm temperatures are resulting in siginifcant snowmelt runoff in the far northwestern Brooks Range. This is causing some rivers and streams to rise to bankfull levels and possibly overbank in low lying areas. entry.summary: ...Air Quality Alert in effect Saturday for Huntsville and Decatur... entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:14AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Williamson and central Burnet Counties through 300 AM CDT... At 214 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burnet, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 2:01AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAT INDEX VALUES BETWEEN 105 AND 110 DEGREES THIS AFTERNOON... The combination of well above average temperatures and supportive dew points will produce heat index values up to 110 degrees for a few hours this afternoon. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 10 at 1:53AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Blanco, northeastern Gillespie, southeastern Llano and northwestern Burnet Counties through 245 AM CDT... At 153 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Llano to near Crabapple. Movement was east at 20 mph.

entry.title: Flood Warning issued June 09 at 3:54PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CDT MONDAY... * WHAT...Urban area and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of the Texas Panhandle, including the following county, Randall. * WHEN...Until 500 PM CDT Monday.

entry.title: Excessive Heat Watch issued June 09 at 8:27PM AST until June 12 at 1:00PM AST by NWS
entry.summary: ...EXCESSIVE HEAT WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Prolonged periods of dangerously hot temperatures and high humidity possible with heat indices of 112 Fahrenheit or more. * WHERE...along the urban and coastal areas of Puerto Rico.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 11:13AM MDT by NWS

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 11:01AM MDT until June 10 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Little Wind River near Riverton affecting Fremont County. .River flows in the Little Wind River continue around bankfull, which causes minor flooding in low-lying areas. Fewer showers and thunderstorms are expected this afternoon, but slightly increased

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 10:51AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Green River near La Barge affecting Lincoln and Sublette Counties. .High-elevation snowmelt continues and automated snowpack estimates reveal about 4.5 inches of water remaining in the snowpack in the mountains around 9,500 feet west of La Barge. entry.title: Flood Advisory issued June 09 at 10:44AM MDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Wyoming... Bear River below Pixley Dam affecting Lincoln County. .High-elevation snowmelt, with snowpack remaining above 9,000 feet, continues.
